intro: Lagenandra ovata, commonly known as the oval leaf lagenandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically yellow when ripe. Lagenandra ovata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
